docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Property Management Services (Licensing and Related Matters) Regulation

main.enactingFormula: (Cap. 626, sections 3(1), 15(1), 16(3), 17(2) and 47(8) and section 5(1) of Schedule 4)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Property management services
section.content: Schedule 1 prescribes property management services for the purposes of section 3(1) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fees
section.content: Schedule 2 prescribes the fees payable for the matters specified in that Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prescribed information that must be contained in applications for licences and provisional PMP licences, and for renewal of licences

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9(1)(b) of the Ordinance, the prescribed information that must be contained in an application for a licence is—

subparagraph.content: information on the identity of the applicant;
if applicable, information on the identity of the applicant’s directors;
if applicable, information on the identity of the applicant’s partners;
information on the identity of the licensed PMPs engaged by the applicant;
contact information of the applicant;

information on whether the applicant is a suitable person to hold the licence, including information on the matters to which the Authority must have regard as referred to in section 11(2) of the Ordinance;

if applicable, information on whether the applicant’s directors are suitable persons to be associated with the applicant’s business of providing property management services, including information on the matters to which the Authority must have regard as referred to in section 11(4) of the Ordinance;
if applicable, the address, type and number of flats of each property for which property management services are provided by the applicant;

subparagraph.leadIn: if applicable, the following information of each property for which property management services are provided by the applicant—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for a property with an owners’ organization—the name and address of the owners’ organization; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for a property without an owners’ organization—the address of each flat in the property;
if a licensed PMC is engaged by the applicant to provide property management services, information on the identity of that licensed PMC;

if the applicant is engaged as a subcontractor to provide property management services, the address and number of flats of each property for which property management services are provided by the applicant as a subcontractor;
if applicable, information on the licensed PMP (Tier 1) appointed by the applicant to show compliance with section 10(d); and
any other information specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence—

subparagraph.content: personal and contact information of the applicant;
if applicable, information on the applicant’s academic qualifications;
if applicable, information on the applicant’s qualifications obtained through the Recognition of Prior Learning mechanism under the Hong Kong Qualifications Framework;
if applicable, information on the applicant’s professional qualifications;
information on the applicant’s relevant work experience in property management;
information on whether the applicant is or was a director of or partner in a licensed PMC;

information on whether the applicant is a suitable person to hold the licence, including information on the matters to which the Authority must have regard as referred to in section 11(3) of the Ordinance;
if applicable, information on the applicant’s completion of the course referred to in section 7(1)(a)(ii);
if applicable, information on the applicant’s completion of the course referred to in section 8(1)(a)(ii); and
any other information specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 10(1)(b) of the Ordinance, the prescribed information that must be contained in an application for the renewal of a licence is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a PMC licence—any information specified by the Authority from among the information referred to in subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence—any information specified by the Authority from among the information referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(2)(c) of Schedule 4 to the Ordinance, the prescribed information that must be contained in an application for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) to (vi) and (x); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information on whether the applicant is a suitable person to hold a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence, including information on the matters to which the Authority must have regard as referred to in section 2(4) of Schedule 4 to the Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Prescribed documents that must accompany applications for licences and provisional PMP licences, and for renewal of licences

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9(1)(c) of the Ordinance, the prescribed documents that must accompany an application for a licence are—

subparagraph.content: if applicable, a copy of the certificate of incorporation of the applicant;

if applicable, a copy of the business registration certificate of the applicant and, if applicable, a copy of the certified extracts of information on the business register that relates to the applicant, issued under the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310);

if applicable, documents showing the information on the identity of the applicant’s directors such as a copy of the notification of changes of secretary and directors and the latest annual return of the applicant that has been delivered to the Registrar of Companies in accordance with the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); and
any other documents specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence—

subparagraph.content: the identity card or passport of the applicant;
if applicable, documents showing the applicant’s academic qualifications;
if applicable, documents showing the applicant’s qualifications obtained through the Recognition of Prior Learning mechanism under the Hong Kong Qualifications Framework;
if applicable, documents showing the applicant’s professional qualifications;
documents showing the applicant’s relevant work experience in property management;
if applicable, documents showing the applicant’s completion of the course referred to in section 7(1)(a)(ii);
if applicable, documents showing the applicant’s completion of the course referred to in section 8(1)(a)(ii);
a recent photograph of the applicant in the specifications specified by the Authority;
documents showing the applicant’s residential address and, if applicable, correspondence address; and
any other documents specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 10(1)(c) of the Ordinance, the prescribed documents that must accompany an application for the renewal of a licence are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a PMC licence—any document specified by the Authority from among the information referred to in subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence—

subparagraph.content: any document specified by the Authority from among the information referred to in subsection (1)(b); and
documents showing compliance with section 11(c).

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 2(2)(d) of Schedule 4 to the Ordinance, the prescribed documents that must accompany an application for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence are the documents referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) to (v) and (viii) to (x).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Prescribed criteria for holding PMC licences
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 9(2)(a)(ii), 10(2)(a)(ii) and 18(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance, the prescribed criteria for holding a PMC licence are that the applicant or the licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engages at least one or is a licensed PMP (Tier 1) who has effective control of the provision of property management services by the applicant or the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engages a number of licensed PMPs that meets the minimum manning ratios that the Authority may from time to time specify.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prescribed criteria for holding PMP (Tier 1) licences

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 9(2)(a)(ii), 10(2)(a)(ii) and 18(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance, the prescribed criteria for holding a PMP (Tier 1) licence are that—

subparagraph.content: has, within the 3 years immediately before the date of the application for the PMP (Tier 1) licence, held a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence; and
has, before the expiry of the provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence, completed a course specified by the Authority;

is a member of a recognized professional body, and if the recognized professional body has different classes, types or divisions of membership (including any class, type or division described in other manners), the applicant or the licensee is also a member of the class, type or division (including the class, type or division described in other manners) that the Authority may from time to time specify;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a bachelor or higher degree or an academic qualification regarded by the Authority as equivalent, in a subject or discipline relating to property management that the Authority may from time to time specify;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a bachelor or higher degree or an academic qualification regarded by the Authority as equivalent and not specified by the Authority under sub-subparagraph (A); or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any other qualification that is considered acceptable by the Authority; and
has the work experience that the Authority may from time to time specify in property management for properties in Hong Kong;

is a member of a recognized professional body, and if the recognized professional body has different classes, types or divisions of membership (including any class, type or division described in other manners), the applicant or the licensee is also a member of the class, type or division (including the class, type or division described in other manners) that the Authority may from time to time specify; and
has, within the 3 years immediately before the date of the application for the PMP (Tier 1) licence, held a PMP (Tier 1) licence; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant or the licensee has, within the 3 years immediately before the date of the application for the PMP (Tier 1) licence, held a PMP (Tier 1) licence the issuance of which was based on the criteria referred to in this paragraph or paragraph (a).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(iii), any years of work experience specified for an applicant or a licensee who holds a qualification referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii)(B) or (C) must be longer than that specified for an applicant or a licensee who holds a qualification referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii)(A).

subsection.def: recognized professional body (認可專業團體) means a professional body that the Authority may from time to time recognize.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Prescribed criteria for holding PMP (Tier 2) licences

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 9(2)(a)(ii), 10(2)(a)(ii) and 18(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance, the prescribed criteria for holding a PMP (Tier 2) licence are that—

subparagraph.content: has, within the 3 years immediately before the date of the application for the PMP (Tier 2) licence, held a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence; and
has, before the expiry of the provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence, completed a course specified by the Authority;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an associate degree or diploma or above or an academic qualification regarded by the Authority as equivalent, in a subject or discipline relating to property management that the Authority may from time to time specify;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a bachelor or higher degree or an academic qualification regarded by the Authority as equivalent and not specified by the Authority under sub-subparagraph (A);

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an associate degree or diploma or above or an academic qualification regarded by the Authority as equivalent and not included in sub-subparagraphs (A) and (B); or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any other qualification that is considered acceptable by the Authority; and
has the work experience that the Authority may from time to time specify in property management for properties in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant or the licensee has, within the 3 years immediately before the date of the application for the PMP (Tier 2) licence, held a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii), any years of work experience specified for an applicant or a licensee who holds a qualification referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i)(C) or (D) must be longer than that specified for an applicant or a licensee who holds a qualification referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i)(A) or (B).

section.name: s9
section.heading: Prescribed criterion for holding provisional PMP licences

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 18(1)(a)(ii) (as applied by section 4(b) of Schedule 4 to the Ordinance) of, and section 2(3)(a)(ii) of Schedule 4 to, the Ordinance, the prescribed criterion for holding a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence (provisional PMP licence) is that the applicant or the holder of the provisional PMP licence has the work experience that the Authority may from time to time specify in assuming a managerial or supervisory role in the provision of property management services for properties in Hong Kong.

For the purposes of subsection (1), any years of work experience specified for an applicant or a holder of a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence must be longer than that specified for an applicant or a holder of a provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Prescribed conditions on PMC licences
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 9(3) and 10(3) of the Ordinance, the prescribed conditions that may be imposed on a PMC licence are that the licensee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to be a suitable person to hold the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue to meet the criteria referred to in section 6 for holding the licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: display a copy of the licence in a prominent place in each property for which property management services are provided by the licensee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: appoint at least one licensed PMP (Tier 1) to manage each property for which property management services are provided by the licensee and display in a prominent place in such property the name and licence number of the licensed PMP (Tier 1) appointed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: state the name and licence number of the licensee clearly and conspicuously on any letter, account, receipt, pamphlet, brochure, advertisement and other documents issued in whatever form by or on behalf of the licensee in the capacity of a licensee;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: submit to the Authority, within the period of time specified by the Authority, the information and documents that the Authority may from time to time specify; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: not carry on the business of providing property management services under a name other than the name of the licensee stated on the PMC licence.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Prescribed conditions on PMP (Tier 1) licences or PMP (Tier 2) licences
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 9(3) and 10(3) of the Ordinance, the prescribed conditions that may be imposed on a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence are that the licensee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to be a suitable person to hold the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: continue to meet the criteria referred to in the following provision for holding the licence—

subparagraph.content: for a PMP (Tier 1) licence—section 7(1); or
for a PMP (Tier 2) licence—section 8(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complete on or before a date specified by the Authority the number of hours specified by the Authority, of attendance of or participation in, continuing professional development courses or activities that the Authority may from time to time recognize or specify;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the licensee is appointed by a licensed PMC to comply with section 10(d)—display in a prominent place in the property for which property management services are provided by the licensee the name and licence number of the licensee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: state the name and licence number of the licensee clearly and conspicuously on any name card, letter, account, receipt, pamphlet, brochure, advertisement and other documents issued in whatever form by or on behalf of the licensee in the capacity of a licensee; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: submit to the Authority, within the period of time specified by the Authority, the information and documents that the Authority may from time to time specify.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Prescribed conditions on provisional PMP licences
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(5) of Schedule 4 to the Ordinance, the prescribed conditions that may be imposed on a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence (provisional PMP licence) are that the holder of the provisional PMP licence must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to be a suitable person to hold the provisional PMP licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue to meet the criterion referred to in section 9(1) for holding the relevant provisional PMP licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complete on or before a date specified by the Authority the number of hours specified by the Authority, of attendance of or participation in, continuing professional development courses or activities that the Authority may from time to time recognize or specify;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: state the name and the provisional PMP licence number of the holder clearly and conspicuously on any name card, letter, account, receipt, pamphlet, brochure, advertisement and other documents issued in whatever form by or on behalf of the holder in the capacity of a holder of a provisional PMP licence; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: submit to the Authority, within the period of time specified by the Authority, the information and documents that the Authority may from time to time specify.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Provision of prescribed information to clients by licensed PMC
section.content: For the purposes of section 16(2) of the Ordinance, the prescribed information that must be provided by a licensed PMC to the PMC’s clients and the prescribed manner of providing such information are set out in Schedule 3.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Notification of changes of prescribed matters
section.content: For the purposes of section 17(1) of the Ordinance, the prescribed matters any change in which must be notified by a licensee to the Authority and the prescribed manner of such notification are set out in Schedule 4.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 2 and 3 of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the services specified in column 3 of the Table in this Schedule are prescribed as property management services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the category of services to which each of the services belong is set out in column 2 of the Table opposite to that service.

section.name: s2
section.content: The duties and obligations performed by an owner or owners’ organization pursuant to the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344) are not property management services.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: A property management service incidental to and necessary for the provision of a property management service under a category of services in column 2 of the Table is regarded as a property management service under that category only.

td.p: General management services relating to a property

General services relating to property management provided pursuant to a deed of mutual covenant (except those property management services corresponding to items 2 to 7) for owners, residents, tenants, users or visitors
Management of the environment of a property
Services for the cleaning, hygiene, landscaping or safety of the environment of a property
Repair, maintenance and improvement of a property
Services for the repair, replacement, maintenance or improvement of a property including the structure and building services installation
Finance and asset management relating to a property
Services for the budgeting, or management of finance, accounts or asset relating to a property
Facility management relating to a property
Services for the management of ancillary facilities in a property (except those property management services corresponding to item 3)
Human resources management relating to personnel involved in the management of a property
Human resources management services in relation to individuals engaged by an owner or owners’ organization in the provision of property management services
Legal services relating to the management of a property

Legal services, generally referring to the provision of information and advice on the legal aspects, in respect of property management services corresponding to items 1 to 6 (except services provided in the course of practising the profession by a solicitor or counsel or any person employed by the solicitor or counsel and acting in furtherance of that course)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: For each matter specified in column 2 of the Table in this Schedule, the fee payable is prescribed in column 3 of the Table opposite to the matter.

td.p: Matter for which a fee is payable
issue of a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence
issue of a provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence
issue or renewal, for a period of 36 months, of—
issue of a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence (for a period of 36 months)
issue of a provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence (for a period of 36 months)
if a licence is issued or renewed for a period of less than 36 months
Calculated on a pro rata monthly basis (part of a month is taken to be a month)
Calculated on a pro rata monthly basis (part of a month is taken to be a month)

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Provision of Prescribed Information to Clients by Licensed PMC

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Information relating to a property for which a licensed PMC provides property management services that must be provided by the PMC to the PMC’s clients and the manner of provision of such information are—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed information is, to the best of the knowledge and belief of the PMC, information concerning conflict of interests between the PMC and the PMC’s clients; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the prescribed manner of provision is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: either of the following—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: within 31 days after receipt of a request by the PMC’s clients and payment of a reasonable copying fee, supplying the PMC’s clients with a copy of the prescribed information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Contracts and documents relating to property management—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed information is information in the contracts entered into for or on behalf of the PMC’s clients in respect of the supply of goods or services and in other documents relating to the management of the property that the Authority may from time to time specify; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the prescribed manner of provision is—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: within 31 days after receipt of a request by the PMC’s clients and payment of a reasonable copying fee, supplying the PMC’s clients with a copy of the prescribed information.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any change of the following matters must be notified by a licensee, within 31 days after the change takes place, to the Authority in writing in the forms specified by the Authority and accompanied by the supporting documents that the Authority may from time to time specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars provided in a licence application form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information relating to the compliance with the criteria for holding a licence and conditions imposed on a licence.
